\begin{thmenv} \label{gen_drc} Let $p\geq 2$ be an even integer. Let $B_1,B_2\subseteq G$ and $\mu =\mu _{B_1}\circ \mu _{B_2}$. For any finite set $A\subseteq G$ with density $\alpha $ and function $f:G\to \mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ there exist $A_1\subseteq B_1$ and $A_2\subseteq B_2$ such that 

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2}, f\rangle \leq 2\frac{\langle (\mu _A\circ \mu _A)^p,f\rangle _\mu }{\lVert \mu _A\circ \mu _A\rVert _{p(\mu )}^p} \]

 and 

\[ \min \left( \mu _{B_1}(A_1),\mu _{B_2}(A_2)\right)\geq \frac{1}{4}\alpha ^{2p}\lVert \mu _A\circ \mu _A\rVert _{p(\mu )}^{2p}. \]

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let p≥2 be an even integer. Let B1,B2⊆G and μ=μB1○μB2. For any finite set A⊆G with density α and function f:GR≥0 there exist A1⊆B1 and A2⊆B2 such that μA1○μA2, f≤2 and  μB1(A1),μB2(A2)≥α2pμA○μAp(μ)2p.

graph.node_source:
\begin{thmenv} \label{local_drc} Let $p\geq 1$ be an integer and $\epsilon ,\delta >0$. Let $B_1,B_2\subseteq G$, and let $\mu =\mu _{B_1}\circ \mu _{B_2}$. For any finite set $A\subseteq G$ with density $\alpha $, if 

\[ S=\{  x\in G: \mu _A\circ \mu _A(x)>(1-\epsilon )\lVert \mu _A\circ \mu _A\rVert _{p(\mu )}\} , \]

 then there are $A_1\subseteq B_1$ and $A_2\subseteq B_2$ such that 

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle \geq 1-\delta  \]

 and 

\[ \min \left( \mu _{B_1}(A_1),\mu _{B_2}(A_2)\right)\gg \left( \alpha \lVert \mu _A\circ \mu _A\rVert _{p(\mu )}\right)^{p+O_{\epsilon ,\delta }(1)}. \]

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let p≥1 be an integer and ε,δ>0. Let B1,B2⊆G, and let μ=μB1○μB2. For any finite set A⊆G with density α, if S={ xG: μA○μA(x)>(1-ε)μA○μAp(μ)}, then there are A1⊆B1 and A2⊆B2 such that μA1○μA2,1S≥1-δ and  μB1(A1),μB2(A2)≫ αμA○μAp(μ)p+Oε,δ(1).

graph.node_source:
\begin{thmenv} \label{di_in_ff} Let $\epsilon \in (0,1)$. If $A,C\subseteq \mathbb {F}_q^n$, where $C$ has density at least $\gamma $, then either 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert \langle \mu _A\ast \mu _A,\mu _C\rangle -1\right\rvert \leq \epsilon $ or 

\item there is a subspace $V$ of codimension 

\[ \ll _\epsilon \log (2/\gamma )^4\log (2/\alpha )^4 \]

 such that $\lVert 1_{A}\ast \mu _V\rVert _\infty \geq (1+\Omega (\epsilon ))\alpha $. 

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let ε(0,1). If A,C⊆Fqn, where C has density at least γ, then either μA*μA,μC-1≤ε or there is a subspace V of codimension ≪ε(2/γ)4(2/α)4 such that 1A*μV∞≥(1+Ω(ε))α.
If A⊆Fqn has only trivial three-term arithmetic progressions then α≤(-n1/9).

graph.node_source:
\begin{thmenv} \label{global_drc} Let $p\geq 1$ be an integer and $\epsilon >0$. If $A\subseteq G$ is such that $\lVert \mu _A\circ \mu _A\rVert _p \geq 1+\epsilon $ and $S=\{  x : \mu _A\circ \mu _A(x)>1+\epsilon /2\} $, then there are $A_1,A_2\subseteq G$, both of density 

\[ \gg \alpha ^{p+O_\epsilon (1)}, \]

 such that 

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle \geq 1-\epsilon /8. \]

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let p≥1 be an integer and ε>0. If A⊆G is such that μA○μAp ≥1+ε and S={ x : μA○μA(x)>1+ε/2}, then there are A1,A2⊆G, both of density ≫αp+Oε(1), such that μA1○μA2,1S≥1-ε/8.
Let ε(0,1) and ν:GR≥0 be some probability measure such that ν≥0. Let f:GR. If f○fp(ν)≥ε for some p≥1 then f○f+1p’(ν)≥1+12ε for some p'≪εp.
For any function f:GR and integer k≥0 Ex f○f(x)k≥0.

\begin{thmenv} \label{ap} Let $\epsilon >0$ and $m\geq 1$. Suppose that $A\subseteq G$ with density $\alpha $. Then, for any function $f:G\to \mathbb {R}$, there exists a set $T$ of size 

\[ \left\lvert T\right\rvert \geq \alpha ^{O(m\epsilon ^{-2})}N \]

 such that for all $t\in T$ 

\[ \lVert \tau _t \mu _A\ast f-\mu _A\ast f\rVert _{2m}\leq \epsilon \lVert f\rVert _{2m}. \]

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let ε>0 and m≥1. Suppose that A⊆G with density α. Then, for any function f:GR, there exists a set T of size T≥αO(mε-2)N such that for all tT τt μA*f-μA*f2m≤εf2m.

\begin{thmenv} \label{linfty_ap} Let $\epsilon >0$ and $m\geq 1$, and $G$ be some finite abelian group of order $N$. Suppose that $A\subseteq G$ with density $\alpha =\left\lvert A\right\rvert /N$. For any function $f:G\to \mathbb {R}$ there is a set $T$ such that 

\[ \left\lvert T\right\rvert \geq \exp (-O(\log (1/\alpha )\log (1/\beta )\epsilon ^{-2})N \]

and for all sets $B$ of density at least $\beta $ and for all $t\in T$ 

\[ \lVert \tau _t \mu _A\ast \mu _B\ast f- \mu _A\ast \mu _B\ast f\rVert _{\infty }\leq \epsilon \lVert f\rVert _{2m}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{global_drc} Let $p\geq 1$ be an integer and $\epsilon >0$. If $A\subseteq G$ is such that $\lVert \mu _A\circ \mu _A\rVert _p \geq 1+\epsilon $ and $S=\{  x : \mu _A\circ \mu _A(x)>1+\epsilon /2\} $, then there are $A_1,A_2\subseteq G$, both of density

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{lem-sift} Let $\epsilon ,\delta >0$ and $p\geq \max (2,\epsilon ^{-1}\log (2/\delta ))$ be an even integer. Let $B_1,B_2\subseteq G$, and let $\mu =\mu _{B_1}\circ \mu _{B_2}$. For any finite set $A\subseteq G$, if 

\[ S=\{  x\in G: 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}(x)>(1-\epsilon )\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}\} , \]

 then there are $A_1\subseteq B_1$ and $A_2\subseteq B_2$ such that 

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle \geq 1-\delta  \]

 and 

\[ \min \left( \frac{\left\lvert A_1\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_1\right\rvert },\frac{\left\lvert A_2\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_2\right\rvert }\right)\geq \frac{1}{4}\left\lvert A\right\rvert ^{-2p}\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^{2p}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{di_in_ff} Let $\epsilon \in (0,1)$. If $A,C\subseteq \mathbb {F}_q^n$, where $C$ has density at least $\gamma $, then either 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert \langle \mu _A\ast \mu _A,\mu _C\rangle -1\right\rvert \leq \epsilon $ or 

\item there is a subspace $V$ of codimension 

\[ \ll _\epsilon \log (2/\gamma )^4\log (2/\alpha )^4 \]

 such that $\lVert 1_{A}\ast \mu _V\rVert _\infty \geq (1+\Omega (\epsilon ))\alpha $. 

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Chang's lemma] \label{chang} If 

\[ \Delta = \{  \gamma : \lvert \widehat{1_{X}(\gamma )}\rvert \geq \eta \mu (X)\}  \]

 then there is a set $\Gamma $ of size $O(\eta ^{-2}\log (1/\mu (X)))$ such that 

\[ \Delta \subseteq \left\{ \sum _{\gamma \in \Gamma }\epsilon _\gamma \gamma : \epsilon _\gamma \in \{ -1,0,1\} \right\} . \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{lem-sift} \lean{sifting} \leanok Let $\epsilon ,\delta >0$ and $p\geq \max (2,\epsilon ^{-1}\log (2/\delta ))$ be an even integer. Let $B_1,B_2\subseteq G$, and let $\mu =\mu _{B_1}\circ \mu _{B_2}$. For any finite set $A\subseteq G$, if 

\[ S=\{  x\in G: 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}(x)>(1-\epsilon )\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}\} , \]

 then there are $A_1\subseteq B_1$ and $A_2\subseteq B_2$ such that 

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle \geq 1-\delta  \]

 and 

\[ \min \left( \frac{\left\lvert A_1\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_1\right\rvert },\frac{\left\lvert A_2\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_2\right\rvert }\right)\geq \frac{1}{4}\left\lvert A\right\rvert ^{-2p}\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^{2p}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{di_in_ff} Let $\epsilon \in (0,1)$. If $A,C\subseteq \mathbb {F}_q^n$, where $C$ has density at least $\gamma $, then either 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert \langle \mu _A\ast \mu _A,\mu _C\rangle -1\right\rvert \leq \epsilon $ or 

\item there is a subspace $V$ of codimension 

\[ \ll _\epsilon \log (2/\gamma )^4\log (2/\alpha )^4 \]

 such that $\lVert 1_{A}\ast \mu _V\rVert _\infty \geq (1+\Omega (\epsilon ))\alpha $. 

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[$L_\infty $ almost periodicity] \label{linfty_ap} Let $\epsilon \in (0,1]$ and $m\geq 1$. Let $K\geq 2$ and $A,S\subseteq G$ with $\lvert A+S\rvert \leq K\lvert A\rvert $. \[ \lvert T\rvert \geq K^{-4096\lceil \mathcal{L}{\eta }\rceil \epsilon ^{-2}}\lvert S\rvert  \]

 such that for any $t\in T$ we have 

\[ \|  \tau _t(\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C)-\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C\| _{\infty }\leq \epsilon . \]

\end{thmenv}

\[ \left\lvert \Delta \right\rvert \leq \lceil e\mathcal{L}(\alpha )\eta ^{-2}\rceil  \]

 and 

\[ \Delta _\eta (f)\subseteq \left\{  \sum _{\gamma \in \Delta }c_\gamma \gamma : c_\gamma \in \{ -1,0,1\}  \right\} . \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{aps_in_translates} \lean{just_the_triangle_inequality} \leanok Let $A\subseteq G$ and $f:G\to \mathbb {C}$. Let $\epsilon >0$ and $m\geq 1$ and $k\geq 1$. Let 

\[ L=\{  {\vec{a}}\in A^k : \| \tfrac {1}{k}\sum _{i=1}^kf(x-a_i)-\mu _A\ast f\| _{2m}\leq \epsilon \|  f\| _{2m}\} . \]

 If $t\in G$ is such that ${\vec{a}}\in L$ and ${\vec{a}}+(t,\ldots ,t)\in L$ then 

\[ \|  \tau _t(\mu _A\ast f)-\mu _A\ast f\| _{2m}\leq 2\epsilon \| f\| _{2m}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{lem-sift} \lean{sifting} \leanok Let $\epsilon ,\delta >0$ and $p\geq \max (2,\epsilon ^{-1}\log (2/\delta ))$ be an even integer. Let $B_1,B_2\subseteq G$, and let $\mu =\mu _{B_1}\circ \mu _{B_2}$. For any finite set $A\subseteq G$, if 

\[ S=\{  x\in G: 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}(x)>(1-\epsilon )\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}\} , \]

 then there are $A_1\subseteq B_1$ and $A_2\subseteq B_2$ such that 

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle \geq 1-\delta  \]

 and 

\[ \min \left( \frac{\left\lvert A_1\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_1\right\rvert },\frac{\left\lvert A_2\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_2\right\rvert }\right)\geq \frac{1}{4}\left\lvert A\right\rvert ^{-2p}\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^{2p}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{lem-drc} \lean{drc} \leanok Let $p\geq 2$ be an even integer. Let $B_1,B_2\subseteq G$ and $\mu =\mu _{B_1}\circ \mu _{B_2}$. For any finite set $A\subseteq G$ and function $f:G\to \mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ there exist $A_1\subseteq B_1$ and $A_2\subseteq B_2$ such that 

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2}, f\rangle \lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^p\leq 2\langle (1_{A}\circ 1_{A})^p,f\rangle _\mu  \]

 and 

\[ \min \left( \frac{\left\lvert A_1\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_1\right\rvert },\frac{\left\lvert A_2\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_2\right\rvert }\right)\geq \frac{1}{4}\left\lvert A\right\rvert ^{-2p}\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^{2p}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[$L_\infty $ almost periodicity] \label{linfty_ap} Let $\epsilon \in (0,1]$ and $m\geq 1$. Let $K\geq 2$ and $A,S\subseteq G$ with $\lvert A+S\rvert \leq K\lvert A\rvert $. Let $B,C\subseteq G$. Let $\eta =\min (1,\lvert C\rvert /\lvert B\rvert )$. There exists $T\subseteq G$ such that 

\[ \lvert T\rvert \geq K^{-4096\lceil \mathcal{L}{\eta }\rceil \epsilon ^{-2}}\lvert S\rvert  \]

 such that for any $t\in T$ we have 

\[ \|  \tau _t(\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C)-\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C\| _{\infty }\leq \epsilon . \]

\end{thmenv}

Let ε>0. If A,C⊆G, where C has density at least γ, then either μA*μA,μC-1≤ε or μA○μA-1p ≥ε/2 for some p≪(2.γ).

graph.node_source:
\begin{thmenv} \label{di_in_ff} Let $\epsilon \in (0,1)$. If $A,C\subseteq \mathbb {F}_q^n$, where $C$ has density at least $\gamma $, then either 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert \langle \mu _A\ast \mu _A,\mu _C\rangle -1\right\rvert \leq \epsilon $ or 

\item there is a subspace $V$ of codimension 

\[ \ll _\epsilon \log (2/\gamma )^4\log (2/\alpha )^4 \]

 such that $\lVert 1_{A}\ast \mu _V\rVert _\infty \geq (1+\Omega (\epsilon ))\alpha $. 

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2}, f\rangle \lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^p\leq 2\langle (1_{A}\circ 1_{A})^p,f\rangle _\mu  \]

 and 

\[ \min \left( \frac{\left\lvert A_1\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_1\right\rvert },\frac{\left\lvert A_2\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_2\right\rvert }\right)\geq \frac{1}{4}\left\lvert A\right\rvert ^{-2p}\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^{2p}. \]

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let p≥2 be an even integer. Let B1,B2⊆G and μ=μB1○μB2. For any finite set A⊆G and function f:GR≥0 there exist A1⊆B1 and A2⊆B2 such that μA1○μA2, f1A○1Ap(μ)p≤2(1A○1A)p,fμ and  ,≥A-2p1A○1Ap(μ)2p.

graph.node_source:
\begin{thmenv} \label{ap_in_ff} If $A_1,A_2,S\subseteq \mathbb {F}_q^n$ are such that $A_1$ and $A_2$ both have density at least $\alpha $ then there is a subspace $V$ of codimension 

\[ \mathrm{codim}(V)\ll _\epsilon \log (2/\alpha )^4 \]

 such that 

\[ \left\lvert \langle \mu _V\ast \mu _{A_1}\ast \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle -\langle \mu _{A_1}\ast \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle \right\rvert \leq \epsilon . \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{lem-sift} \lean{sifting} \leanok Let $\epsilon ,\delta >0$ and $p\geq \max (2,\epsilon ^{-1}\log (2/\delta ))$ be an even integer. Let $B_1,B_2\subseteq G$, and let $\mu =\mu _{B_1}\circ \mu _{B_2}$. For any finite set $A\subseteq G$, if 

\[ S=\{  x\in G: 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}(x)>(1-\epsilon )\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}\} , \]

 then there are $A_1\subseteq B_1$ and $A_2\subseteq B_2$ such that 

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle \geq 1-\delta  \]

 and 

\[ \min \left( \frac{\left\lvert A_1\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_1\right\rvert },\frac{\left\lvert A_2\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_2\right\rvert }\right)\geq \frac{1}{4}\left\lvert A\right\rvert ^{-2p}\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^{2p}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Chang's lemma] \label{chang} Let $G$ be a finite abelian group and $f:G\to \mathbb {C}$. Let $\eta >0$ and $\alpha =N^{-1}\lVert f\rVert _1^2/\lVert f\rVert _2^2$. There exists some $\Delta \subseteq \Delta _\eta (f)$ such that 

\[ \left\lvert \Delta \right\rvert \leq \lceil e\mathcal{L}(\alpha )\eta ^{-2}\rceil  \]

 and 

\[ \Delta _\eta (f)\subseteq \left\{  \sum _{\gamma \in \Delta }c_\gamma \gamma : c_\gamma \in \{ -1,0,1\}  \right\} . \]

\end{thmenv}

Let Δ⊆G and m≥1. Let ν:GC. Then E2m(Δ;ν)=∑γ1,…,γ2mΔν(γ1+-γ2m).

\begin{thmenv} \label{random_approx_expect} \lean{lemma28} \leanok Let $\epsilon >0$ and $m\geq 1$. Let $A\subseteq G$ and $f:G\to \mathbb {C}$. If $k\geq 64m\epsilon ^{-2}$ then the set 

\[ L=\{  {\vec{a}}\in A^k : \| \tfrac {1}{k}\sum _{i=1}^kf(x-a_i)-\mu _A\ast f\| _{2m}\leq \epsilon \|  f\| _{2m}\} . \]

 has size at least $\lvert A \rvert ^k/2$. 

\end{thmenv}

graph.node_source:
\begin{thmenv} \label{di_in_ff} Let $\epsilon \in (0,1)$. If $A,C\subseteq \mathbb {F}_q^n$, where $C$ has density at least $\gamma $, then either 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert \langle \mu _A\ast \mu _A,\mu _C\rangle -1\right\rvert \leq \epsilon $ or 

\item there is a subspace $V$ of codimension 

\[ \ll _\epsilon \log (2/\gamma )^4\log (2/\alpha )^4 \]

 such that $\lVert 1_{A}\ast \mu _V\rVert _\infty \geq (1+\Omega (\epsilon ))\alpha $. 

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let ε(0,1). If A,C⊆Fqn, where C has density at least γ, then either μA*μA,μC-1≤ε or there is a subspace V of codimension ≪ε(2/γ)4(2/α)4 such that 1A*μV∞≥(1+Ω(ε))α.

graph.node_source:
\begin{thmenv}[$L_p$ almost periodicity] \label{lp_ap} \lean{almost_periodicity} \leanok Let $\epsilon \in (0,1]$ and $m\geq 1$. Let $K\geq 2$ and $A,S\subseteq G$ with $\lvert A+S\rvert \leq K\lvert A\rvert $. Let $f:G\to \mathbb {C}$. There exists $T\subseteq G$ such that 

\[ \lvert T\rvert \geq K^{-512m\epsilon ^{-2}}\lvert S\rvert  \]

 such that for any $t\in T$ we have 

\[ \|  \tau _t(\mu _A\ast f)-\mu _A\ast f\| _{2m}\leq \epsilon \|  f\| _{2m}. \]

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let ε(0,1] and m≥1. Let K≥2 and A,S⊆G with A+S≤KA. Let f:GC. There exists T⊆G such that T≥K-512mε-2S such that for any tT we have  τt(μA*f)-μA*f2m≤ε f2m.

graph.node_source:
\begin{thmenv}[$L_\infty $ almost periodicity] \label{linfty_ap} Let $\epsilon \in (0,1]$ and $m\geq 1$. Let $K\geq 2$ and $A,S\subseteq G$ with $\lvert A+S\rvert \leq K\lvert A\rvert $. Let $B,C\subseteq G$. Let $\eta =\min (1,\lvert C\rvert /\lvert B\rvert )$. There exists $T\subseteq G$ such that 

\[ \lvert T\rvert \geq K^{-4096\lceil \mathcal{L}{\eta }\rceil \epsilon ^{-2}}\lvert S\rvert  \]

 such that for any $t\in T$ we have 

\[ \|  \tau _t(\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C)-\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C\| _{\infty }\leq \epsilon . \]

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let ε(0,1] and m≥1. Let K≥2 and A,S⊆G with A+S≤KA. Let B,C⊆G. Let η=(1,C/B). There exists T⊆G such that T≥K-4096Lηε-2S such that for any tT we have  τt(μA*1B*μC)-μA*1B*μC∞≤ε.

\[ L=\{  {\vec{a}}\in A^k : \| \tfrac {1}{k}\sum _{i=1}^kf(x-a_i)-\mu _A\ast f\| _{2m}\leq \epsilon \|  f\| _{2m}\} . \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{lem-sift} \lean{sifting} \leanok Let $\epsilon ,\delta >0$ and $p\geq \max (2,\epsilon ^{-1}\log (2/\delta ))$ be an even integer. Let $B_1,B_2\subseteq G$, and let $\mu =\mu _{B_1}\circ \mu _{B_2}$. For any finite set $A\subseteq G$, if 

\[ S=\{  x\in G: 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}(x)>(1-\epsilon )\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}\} , \]

 then there are $A_1\subseteq B_1$ and $A_2\subseteq B_2$ such that 

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle \geq 1-\delta  \]

 and 

\[ \min \left( \frac{\left\lvert A_1\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_1\right\rvert },\frac{\left\lvert A_2\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_2\right\rvert }\right)\geq \frac{1}{4}\left\lvert A\right\rvert ^{-2p}\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^{2p}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Chang's lemma] \label{chang} \uses{large_spec} \lean{chang} \leanok Let $G$ be a finite abelian group and $f:G\to \mathbb {C}$. Let $\eta >0$ and $\alpha =N^{-1}\lVert f\rVert _1^2/\lVert f\rVert _2^2$. There exists some $\Delta \subseteq \Delta _\eta (f)$ such that 

\[ \left\lvert \Delta \right\rvert \leq \lceil e\mathcal{L}(\alpha )\eta ^{-2}\rceil  \]

 and 

\[ \Delta _\eta (f)\subseteq \left\{  \sum _{\gamma \in \Delta }c_\gamma \gamma : c_\gamma \in \{ -1,0,1\}  \right\} . \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[$L_\infty $ almost periodicity] \label{linfty_ap} Let $\epsilon \in (0,1]$ and $m\geq 1$. Let $K\geq 2$ and $A,S\subseteq G$ with $\lvert A+S\rvert \leq K\lvert A\rvert $. Let $B,C\subseteq G$. Let $\eta =\min (1,\lvert C\rvert /\lvert B\rvert )$. There exists $T\subseteq G$ such that 

\[ \lvert T\rvert \geq K^{-4096\lceil \mathcal{L}{\eta }\rceil \epsilon ^{-2}}\lvert S\rvert  \]

 such that for any $t\in T$ we have 

\[ \|  \tau _t(\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C)-\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C\| _{\infty }\leq \epsilon . \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{di_in_ff} Let $\epsilon \in (0,1)$. If $A,C\subseteq \mathbb {F}_q^n$, where $C$ has density at least $\gamma $, then either 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert \langle \mu _A\ast \mu _A,\mu _C\rangle -1\right\rvert \leq \epsilon $ or 

\item there is a subspace $V$ of codimension 

\[ \ll _\epsilon \log (2/\gamma )^4\log (2/\alpha )^4 \]

 such that $\lVert 1_{A}\ast \mu _V\rVert _\infty \geq (1+\Omega (\epsilon ))\alpha $. 

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[$L_\infty $ almost periodicity] \label{linfty_ap} Let $\epsilon \in (0,1]$ and $m\geq 1$. Let $K\geq 2$ and $A,S\subseteq G$ with $\lvert A+S\rvert \leq K\lvert A\rvert $. Let $B,C\subseteq G$. Let $\eta =\min (1,\lvert C\rvert /\lvert B\rvert )$. There exists $T\subseteq G$ such that 

\[ \lvert T\rvert \geq K^{-4096\lceil \mathcal{L}{\eta }\rceil \epsilon ^{-2}}\lvert S\rvert  \]

 such that for any $t\in T$ we have 

\[ \|  \tau _t(\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C)-\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C\| _{\infty }\leq \epsilon . \]

\end{thmenv}

\end{thmenv}

\[ \left\lvert \Delta \right\rvert \leq \lceil e\mathcal{L}(\alpha )\eta ^{-2}\rceil  \]

 and 

\[ \Delta _\eta (f)\subseteq \left\{  \sum _{\gamma \in \Delta }c_\gamma \gamma : c_\gamma \in \{ -1,0,1\}  \right\} . \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{drc} \lean{drc} \leanok Let $p\geq 2$ be an even integer. Let $B_1,B_2\subseteq G$ and $\mu =\mu _{B_1}\circ \mu _{B_2}$. For any finite set $A\subseteq G$ and function $f:G\to \mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ there exist $A_1\subseteq B_1$ and $A_2\subseteq B_2$ such that 

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2}, f\rangle \lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^p\leq 2\langle (1_{A}\circ 1_{A})^p,f\rangle _\mu  \]

 and 

\[ \min \left( \frac{\left\lvert A_1\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_1\right\rvert },\frac{\left\lvert A_2\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_2\right\rvert }\right)\geq \frac{1}{4}\left\lvert A\right\rvert ^{-2p}\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^{2p}. \]

\begin{thmenv}[Dissociation] \label{dissociated} \lean{AddDissociated} \leanok We say that $A\subseteq G$ is dissociated if, for any $m\geq 1$, and any $x\in G$, there is at most one $A'\subset A$ of size $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert =m$ such that 

\[ \sum _{a\in A'}a=x. \]

 It follows that 

\[ \mathbb {E}_x e^{\left\lvert \Re f(x)\right\rvert } \leq 2e^{\|  f\| _2^2/2}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{Lp-orth} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\epsilon >0$ and $p \geq 2$ be an integer. Let $B \subseteq G$ be a regular Bohr set and $A\subseteq B$ with relative density $\alpha $. Let $\nu : G \to \mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ be supported on $B_\rho $, where $\rho \leq c\epsilon \alpha /\rk (B)$, such that $\lVert \nu \rVert _1=1$ and $\widehat{\nu }\geq 0$. If 

\[  \lVert (\mu _A-\mu _B) \circ (\mu _{A}-\mu _B)\rVert _{p(\nu )} \geq \epsilon \,  \mu (B)^{-1},  \]

 then there exists $p'\ll _\epsilon p$ such that 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{A}\circ \mu _{A}\rVert _{p'(\nu )} \geq \left(1+\tfrac {1}{4}\epsilon \right) \mu (B)^{-1}.  \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{flat-on-bohr} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let ${\epsilon ,\delta \in (0,1)}$ and $p,k\geq 1$ be integers such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. For any $A\subseteq G$ with density $\alpha $ there is a regular Bohr set $B$ with 

\[  d=\rk (B) =O_{\epsilon }\left(\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^5p^4\right) \quad \text{and}\quad \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-O_{\epsilon ,\delta }(\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^6p^5\mathcal{L}{\alpha /p})\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert   \]

 and some $A'\subseteq (A-x)\cap B$ for some $x \in G$ such that 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B\right\rvert $, 

\item $\left\lvert A'\cap B'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B'\right\rvert $, where $B'=B_{\rho }$ is a regular Bohr set with ${\rho \in (\tfrac {1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /d}$, and 

\item \[ \lVert \mu _{A'}\circ \mu _{A'}\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B''}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B''}\ast \mu _{k\cdot B'''}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B'''})} <(1+ \epsilon )\mu (B)^{-1}, \]

 for any regular Bohr sets $B'' = B'_{\rho '}$ and $B'''=B''_{\rho ''}$ satisfying ${\rho ’,\rho ”\in (\frac{1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /d}$. 

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

egin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] For a non-empty $\Gamma \subseteq \widehat{G}$ and $
u \in [0,2]$ we define the Bohr set $B=\mathrm{Bohr}_
u (\Gamma )$ as 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}_
u (\Gamma )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)ightvert \leq 
u 	extrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma ight\} . \]

 We call $\Gamma $ the \emph{frequency set} of $B$ and $
u $ the \emph{width}, and define the \emph{rank} of $B$ to be the size of $\Gamma $, denoted by $k (B)$. We note here that all Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. 

In fact, when we speak of a Bohr set we implicitly refer to the triple $(\Gamma ,
u ,\mathrm{Bohr}_
u (\Gamma ))$, since the set $\mathrm{Bohr}_{
u }(\Gamma )$ alone does not uniquely determine the frequency set nor the width. When we use subset notation, such as $B'\subseteq B$, this refers only to the set inclusion (and does not, in particular, imply any particular relation between the associated frequency sets or width functions). Furthermore, if $B=\mathrm{Bohr}_
u (\Gamma )$ and $ho \in (0,1]$, then we write $B_ho $ for the same Bohr set with the width dilated by $ho $, i.e. $\mathrm{Bohr}_{ho 
u }(\Gamma )$, which is known as a \emph{dilate} of $B$. 

\end{thmenv}

In fact, when we speak of a Bohr set we implicitly refer to the triple (Γ,ν,Bohrν(Γ)), since the set Bohrν(Γ) alone does not uniquely determine the frequency set nor the width. \begin{thmenv} \label{prop-it} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\epsilon >0$ and $p,k\geq 1$ be integers such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. Let $B,B',B''\subseteq G$ be regular Bohr sets of rank $d$ such that $B''\subseteq B'_{c/d}$ and $A\subseteq B$ with relative density $\alpha $. If 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{A}\circ \mu _{A}\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B'}\ast \mu _{k\cdot B''}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B''})} \geq \left(1+\epsilon \right) \mu (B)^{-1}, \]

 then there is a regular Bohr set $B'''\subseteq B''$ of rank at most 

\[ \rk (B''')\leq d+O_{\epsilon }(\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^4p^4) \]

 and size 

\[ \left\lvert B'''\right\rvert \geq \exp (-O_{\epsilon }(dp\mathcal{L}{\alpha /d}+\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^5p^5))\left\lvert B''\right\rvert  \]

 such that 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{B'''}*\mu _A \rVert _\infty \geq (1+c\epsilon )\mu (B)^{-1}.  \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Chang's lemma] \label{chang} \uses{large_spec} \lean{chang} \leanok Let $G$ be a finite abelian group and $f:G\to \mathbb {C}$. Let $\eta >0$ and $\alpha =N^{-1}\lVert f\rVert _1^2/\lVert f\rVert _2^2$. There exists some $\Delta \subseteq \Delta _\eta (f)$ such that 

\[ \left\lvert \Delta \right\rvert \leq \lceil e\mathcal{L}(\alpha )\eta ^{-2}\rceil  \]

 and 

\[ \Delta _\eta (f)\subseteq \left\{  \sum _{\gamma \in \Delta }c_\gamma \gamma : c_\gamma \in \{ -1,0,1\}  \right\} . \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Dissociation] \label{dissociated} \lean{AddDissociated} \leanok We say that $A\subseteq G$ is dissociated if, for any $m\geq 1$, and any $x\in G$, there is at most one $A'\subset A$ of size $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert =m$ such that 

\[ \sum _{a\in A'}a=x. \]

 It follows that 

\[ \mathbb {E}_x e^{\left\lvert \Re f(x)\right\rvert } \leq 2e^{\|  f\| _2^2/2}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\[ \left\lvert N\langle \mu _A\ast \mu _A,\mu _C\rangle -1\right\rvert >\epsilon  \]

\begin{thmenv} \label{drc} \lean{drc} \leanok Let $p\geq 2$ be an even integer. Let $B_1,B_2\subseteq G$ and $\mu =\mu _{B_1}\circ \mu _{B_2}$. For any finite set $A\subseteq G$ and function $f:G\to \mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ there exist $A_1\subseteq B_1$ and $A_2\subseteq B_2$ such that 

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2}, f\rangle \lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^p\leq 2\langle (1_{A}\circ 1_{A})^p,f\rangle _\mu  \]

 and 

\[ \min \left( \frac{\left\lvert A_1\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_1\right\rvert },\frac{\left\lvert A_2\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_2\right\rvert }\right)\geq \frac{1}{4}\left\lvert A\right\rvert ^{-2p}\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^{2p}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{sift_cor} \lean{sifting_cor} \leanok Let $\epsilon ,\delta >0$ and $p\geq \max (2,\epsilon ^{-1}\log (2/\delta ))$ be an even integer and $\mu \equiv 1/N$. If $A\subseteq G$ has density $\alpha $ and

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{linfty_ap_boosted} \lean{AlmostPeriodicity.linfty_almost_periodicity_boosted} \leanok Let $\epsilon \in (0,1]$ and $k\geq 1$. Let $K\geq 2$ and $A,S\subseteq G$ with $\lvert A+S\rvert \leq K\lvert A\rvert $. Let $B,C\subseteq G$. Let $\eta =\min (1,\lvert C\rvert /\lvert B\rvert )$. There exists $T\subseteq G$ such that

\begin{thmenv} \label{th-ap-int} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\epsilon >0$ and $B,B'\subseteq G$ be regular Bohr sets of rank $d$. Suppose that $A_1\subseteq B$ with density $\alpha _1$ and $A_2$ is such that there exists $x$ with $A_2\subseteq B'-x$ with density $\alpha _2$. Let $S$ be any set with $\left\lvert S\right\rvert \leq 2\left\lvert B\right\rvert $. There is a regular Bohr set $B''\subseteq B'$ of rank at most 

\[ d+O_\epsilon (\mathcal{L}{\alpha _1}^3\mathcal{L}{\alpha _2}) \]

 and size 

\[ \left\lvert B''\right\rvert \geq \exp (-O_\epsilon (d\mathcal{L}{\alpha _1\alpha _2/d}+\mathcal{L}{\alpha _1}^3\mathcal{L}{\alpha _2}\mathcal{L}{\alpha _1\alpha _2/d}))\left\lvert B'\right\rvert  \]

 such that 

\[ \left\lvert \langle \mu _{B'}\ast \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle -\langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle \right\rvert \leq \epsilon . \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{th-int-gen} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\delta ,\epsilon \in (0,1)$, let $p \geq 1$ and let $k$ be a positive integer such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. There is a constant $C=C(\epsilon ,\delta ,k)>0$ such that the following holds. 

For any finite abelian group $G$ and any subset $A\subseteq G$ with $\left\lvert A\right\rvert =\alpha \left\lvert G\right\rvert $ there exists a regular Bohr set $B$ with 

\[ \rk (B)\leq Cp^4\log (2/\alpha )^5 \]

 and 

\[ \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-Cp^5\log (2p/\alpha )\log (2/\alpha )^6\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert  \]

 and $A' \subseteq (A-x)\cap B$ for some $x\in G$ such that 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B\right\rvert $, 

\item $\left\lvert A'\cap B'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B'\right\rvert $, where $B'=B_{\rho }$ is a regular Bohr set with $\rho \in (\tfrac {1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /dk$, and 

\item \[ \lVert (\mu _{A'}-\mu _B)\ast (\mu _{A'}- \mu _B)\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'})} \leq \epsilon \frac{\left\lvert G\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B\right\rvert }. \]

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

There is a constant C=C(ε,δ,k)>0 such that the following holds. For any finite abelian group G and any subset A⊆G with A=αG there exists a regular Bohr set B with (B)≤Cp4(2/α)5 and B≥-Cp5(2p/α)(2/α)6G and A' ⊆(A-x)∩B for some xG such that A'≥(1-ε)αB, A'∩B'≥(1-ε)αB', where B'=Bρ is a regular Bohr set with ρ(12,1)·cδα/dk, and (μA’-μB)*(μA’- μB)p(μk·B’) ≤ε.

\[ \lvert A\rvert \leq \frac{N}{\exp (-c(\log N)^{1/12})} \]

 for some constant $c>0$. 

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Rudin's exponential inequality] \label{rudin_exp} \uses{dissociated} \lean{rudin_exp_ineq} \leanok If the discrete Fourier transform of $f : G \longrightarrow \mathbb {C}$ has dissociated support, then 

\[ \mathbb {E}\exp (\Re f) \le \exp \left(\frac{\lVert f\rVert _2^2}2\right) \]

 It follows that

egin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} For a non-empty $\Gamma \subseteq \widehat{G}$ and $

u (\Gamma )$ as 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}_
u (\Gamma )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)ightvert \leq 
u 	extrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma ight\} . \]

 We call $\Gamma $ the \emph{frequency set} of $B$ and $
u $ the \emph{width}, and define the \emph{rank} of $B$ to be the size of $\Gamma $, denoted by $k (B)$. We note here that all Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. 

In fact, when we speak of a Bohr set we implicitly refer to the triple $(\Gamma ,
u ,\mathrm{Bohr}_
u (\Gamma ))$, since the set $\mathrm{Bohr}_{
u }(\Gamma )$ alone does not uniquely determine the frequency set nor the width. When we use subset notation, such as $B'\subseteq B$, this refers only to the set inclusion (and does not, in particular, imply any particular relation between the associated frequency sets or width functions). Furthermore, if $B=\mathrm{Bohr}_
u (\Gamma )$ and $ho \in (0,1]$, then we write $B_ho $ for the same Bohr set with the width dilated by $ho $, i.e. $\mathrm{Bohr}_{ho 
u }(\Gamma )$, which is known as a \emph{dilate} of $B$. 

\end{thmenv}

egin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} For a non-empty $\Gamma \subseteq \widehat{G}$ and $
u \in [0,2]$ we define the Bohr set $B=\mathrm{Bohr}_
u (\Gamma )$ as 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}_
u (\Gamma )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)ightvert \leq 
u 	extrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma ight\} . \]

 We call $\Gamma $ the \emph{frequency set} of $B$ and $
u $ the \emph{width}, and define the \emph{rank} of $B$ to be the size of $\Gamma $, denoted by $k (B)$. We note here that all Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. 

In fact, when we speak of a Bohr set we implicitly refer to the triple $(\Gamma ,
u ,\mathrm{Bohr}_
u (\Gamma ))$, since the set $\mathrm{Bohr}_{
u }(\Gamma )$ alone does not uniquely determine the frequency set nor the width. When we use subset notation, such as $B'\subseteq B$, this refers only to the set inclusion (and does not, in particular, imply any particular relation between the associated frequency sets or width functions). Furthermore, if $B=\mathrm{Bohr}_
u (\Gamma )$ and $ho \in (0,1]$, then we write $B_ho $ for the same Bohr set with the width dilated by $ho $, i.e. $\mathrm{Bohr}_{ho 
u }(\Gamma )$, which is known as a \emph{dilate} of $B$. 

\end{thmenv}

We call Γ the frequency set of B and ν the width, and define the rank of B to be the size of Γ, denoted by (B). We note here that all Bohr sets are symmetric and contain 0. In fact, when we speak of a Bohr set we implicitly refer to the triple (Γ,ν,Bohrν(Γ)), since the set Bohrν(Γ) alone does not uniquely determine the frequency set nor the width. When we use subset notation, such as B'⊆B, this refers only to the set inclusion (and does not, in particular, imply any particular relation between the associated frequency sets or width functions). Furthermore, if B=Bohrν(Γ) and ρ(0,1], then we write Bρ for the same Bohr set with the width dilated by ρ, i.e. Bohrρν(Γ), which is known as a dilate of B.

Let $B,B',B''\subseteq G$ be regular Bohr sets of rank $d$ such that $B''\subseteq B'_{c/d}$ and $A\subseteq B$ with relative density $\alpha $. If 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{A}\circ \mu _{A}\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B'}\ast \mu _{k\cdot B''}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B''})} \geq \left(1+\epsilon \right) \mu (B)^{-1}, \]

 then there is a regular Bohr set $B'''\subseteq B''$ of rank at most 

\[ \rk (B''')\leq d+O_{\epsilon }(\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^4p^4) \]

\[ \left\lvert B'''\right\rvert \geq \exp (-O_{\epsilon }(dp\mathcal{L}{\alpha /d}+\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^5p^5))\left\lvert B''\right\rvert  \]

 such that

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\rho )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}

The rank of ν, denoted by rk(ν), is defined to be the size of the set of those γG such that ν(γ)<2. (Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain 0. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume ν takes only values in R≥0 - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.)

\begin{thmenv}[$L_\infty $ almost periodicity] \label{linfty_ap} \lean{AlmostPeriodicity.linfty_almost_periodicity} \leanok Let $\epsilon \in (0,1]$. \begin{thmenv}[Dissociation] \label{dissociated} \lean{AddDissociated} \leanok We say that $A\subseteq G$ is dissociated if, for any $m\geq 1$, and any $x\in G$, there is at most one $A'\subset A$ of size $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert =m$ such that 

\[ \sum _{a\in A'}a=x. \]

 It follows that 

\[ \mathbb {E}_x e^{\left\lvert \Re f(x)\right\rvert } \leq 2e^{\|  f\| _2^2/2}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let ν: G R. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be Bohr(ν)= xG : 1-γ(x)≤ν(γ) for all γΓ. The rank of ν, denoted by rk(ν), is defined to be the size of the set of those γG such that ν(γ)<2. (Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain 0. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume ν takes only values in R≥0 - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.)

\begin{thmenv}[Dissociation] \label{dissociated} \lean{AddDissociated} \leanok We say that $A\subseteq G$ is dissociated if, for any $m\geq 1$, and any $x\in G$, there is at most one $A'\subset A$ of size $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert =m$ such that

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} \lean{BohrSet} \leanok Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{th-int-gen} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\delta ,\epsilon \in (0,1)$, let $p \geq 1$ and let $k$ be a positive integer such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. There is a constant $C=C(\epsilon ,\delta ,k)>0$ such that the following holds. 

For any finite abelian group $G$ and any subset $A\subseteq G$ with $\left\lvert A\right\rvert =\alpha \left\lvert G\right\rvert $ there exists a regular Bohr set $B$ with 

\[ \operatorname{rank}(B)\leq Cp^4\log (2/\alpha )^5 \]

 and 

\[ \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-Cp^5\log (2p/\alpha )\log (2/\alpha )^6\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert  \]

 and $A' \subseteq (A-x)\cap B$ for some $x\in G$ such that 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B\right\rvert $, 

\item $\left\lvert A'\cap B'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B'\right\rvert $, where $B'=B_{\rho }$ is a regular Bohr set with $\rho \in (\tfrac {1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /dk$, and 

\item \[ \lVert (\mu _{A'}-\mu _B)\ast (\mu _{A'}- \mu _B)\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'})} \leq \epsilon \frac{\left\lvert G\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B\right\rvert }. \]

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

Let $\nu : G \to \mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ be supported on $B_\rho $, where $\rho \leq c\epsilon \alpha /\operatorname{rank}(B)$, such that $\lVert \nu \rVert _1=1$ and $\widehat{\nu }\geq 0$. If 

\[  \lVert (\mu _A-\mu _B) \circ (\mu _{A}-\mu _B)\rVert _{p(\nu )} \geq \epsilon \,  \mu (B)^{-1},  \]

 then there exists $p'\ll _\epsilon p$ such that 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{A}\circ \mu _{A}\rVert _{p'(\nu )} \geq \left(1+\tfrac {1}{4}\epsilon \right) \mu (B)^{-1}.  \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[$L_p$ almost periodicity] \label{lp_ap} \lean{AlmostPeriodicity.almost_periodicity} \leanok Let $\epsilon \in (0,1]$ and $m\geq 1$. Let $K\geq 2$ and $A,S\subseteq G$ with $\lvert A+S\rvert \leq K\lvert A\rvert $. Let $f:G\to \mathbb {C}$. There exists $T\subseteq G$ such that

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} \lean{BohrSet} \leanok Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}

Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume ν takes only values in R≥0 - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.)

\[ \mathbb {E}\exp (\Re f) \le \exp \left(\frac{\lVert f\rVert _2^2}2\right) \]

 It follows that

 then there is a regular Bohr set $B'''\subseteq B''$ of rank at most 

\[ \operatorname{rank}(B''')\leq d+O_{\epsilon }(\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^4p^4) \]

 such that 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{B'''}*\mu _A \rVert _\infty \geq (1+c\epsilon )\mu (B)^{-1}.  \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{Lp-orth} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\epsilon >0$ and $p \geq 2$ be an integer. Let $B \subseteq G$ be a regular Bohr set and $A\subseteq B$ with relative density $\alpha $. Let $\nu : G \to \mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ be supported on $B_\rho $, where $\rho \leq c\epsilon \alpha /\operatorname{rank}(B)$, such that $\lVert \nu \rVert _1=1$ and $\widehat{\nu }\geq 0$. If 

\[  \lVert (\mu _A-\mu _B) \circ (\mu _{A}-\mu _B)\rVert _{p(\nu )} \geq \epsilon \,  \mu (B)^{-1},  \]

 then there exists $p'\ll _\epsilon p$ such that 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{A}\circ \mu _{A}\rVert _{p'(\nu )} \geq \left(1+\tfrac {1}{4}\epsilon \right) \mu (B)^{-1}.  \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{flat-on-bohr} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. \[  d=\operatorname{rank}(B) =O_{\epsilon }\left(\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^5p^4\right) \quad \text{and}\quad \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-O_{\epsilon ,\delta }(\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^6p^5\mathcal{L}{\alpha /p})\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert   \]

\begin{thmenv}[Dissociation] \label{dissociated} \lean{AddDissociated} \leanok We say that $A\subseteq G$ is dissociated if, for any $m\geq 1$, and any $x\in G$, there is at most one $A'\subset A$ of size $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert =m$ such that 

\[ \sum _{a\in A'}a=x. \]

 It follows that 

\[ \mathbb {E}_x e^{\left\lvert \Re f(x)\right\rvert } \leq 2e^{\|  f\| _2^2/2}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{th-int-gen} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\delta ,\epsilon \in (0,1)$, let $p \geq 1$ and let $k$ be a positive integer such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. There is a constant $C=C(\epsilon ,\delta ,k)>0$ such that the following holds. 

For any finite abelian group $G$ and any subset $A\subseteq G$ with $\left\lvert A\right\rvert =\alpha \left\lvert G\right\rvert $ there exists a regular Bohr set $B$ with 

\[ \operatorname{rank}(B)\leq Cp^4\log (2/\alpha )^5 \]

 and 

\[ \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-Cp^5\log (2p/\alpha )\log (2/\alpha )^6\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert  \]

 and $A' \subseteq (A-x)\cap B$ for some $x\in G$ such that 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B\right\rvert $, 

\item $\left\lvert A'\cap B'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B'\right\rvert $, where $B'=B_{\rho }$ is a regular Bohr set with $\rho \in (\tfrac {1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /dk$, and 

\item \[ \lVert (\mu _{A'}-\mu _B)\ast (\mu _{A'}- \mu _B)\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'})} \leq \epsilon \frac{\left\lvert G\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B\right\rvert }. \]

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

For any finite abelian group G and any subset A⊆G with A=αG there exists a regular Bohr set B with \operatorname{rank}(B)≤Cp4(2/α)5 and B≥-Cp5(2p/α)(2/α)6G and A' ⊆(A-x)∩B for some xG such that A'≥(1-ε)αB, A'∩B'≥(1-ε)αB', where B'=Bρ is a regular Bohr set with ρ(12,1)·cδα/dk, and (μA’-μB)*(μA’- μB)p(μk·B’) ≤ε.

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} \lean{BohrSet} \leanok Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let ν: G R. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be Bohr(ν)= xG : 1-γ(x)≤ν(γ) for all γΓ. The rank of ν, denoted by rk(ν), is defined to be the size of the set of those γG such that ν(γ)<2. (Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain 0. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume ν takes only values in R≥0 - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.)

\begin{thmenv} \label{th-int-gen} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. \[ \operatorname{rank}(B)\leq Cp^4\log (2/\alpha )^5 \]

\[ \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-Cp^5\log (2p/\alpha )\log (2/\alpha )^6\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert  \]

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} \lean{BohrSet} \leanok Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}

Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume ν takes only values in R≥0 - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.)

\begin{thmenv} \label{prop-it} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\epsilon >0$ and $p,k\geq 1$ be integers such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. Let $B,B',B''\subseteq G$ be regular Bohr sets of rank $d$ such that $B''\subseteq B'_{c/d}$ and $A\subseteq B$ with relative density $\alpha $. If 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{A}\circ \mu _{A}\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B'}\ast \mu _{k\cdot B''}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B''})} \geq \left(1+\epsilon \right) \mu (B)^{-1}, \]

 then there is a regular Bohr set $B'''\subseteq B''$ of rank at most 

\[ \operatorname{rank}(B''')\leq d+O_{\epsilon }(\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^4p^4) \]

 and size 

\[ \left\lvert B'''\right\rvert \geq \exp (-O_{\epsilon }(dp\mathcal{L}{\alpha /d}+\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^5p^5))\left\lvert B''\right\rvert  \]

 such that 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{B'''}*\mu _A \rVert _\infty \geq (1+c\epsilon )\mu (B)^{-1}.  \]

\end{thmenv}

Let B,B',B''⊆G be regular Bohr sets of rank d such that B''⊆B'c/d and A⊆B with relative density α. If   μA○μAp(μk·B’○μk·B’*μk·B”○μk·B”) ≥1+ε μ(B)-1, then there is a regular Bohr set B'''⊆B'' of rank at most \operatorname{rank}(B''')≤d+Oε(Lα4p4) and size B'''≥(-Oε(dpLα/d+Lα5p5))B'' such that   μB”’*μA ∞≥(1+cε)μ(B)-1.

\begin{thmenv}[$L_\infty $ almost periodicity] \label{linfty_ap} \lean{AlmostPeriodicity.linfty_almost_periodicity} \leanok Let $\epsilon \in (0,1]$. Let $K\geq 2$ and $A,S\subseteq G$ with $\lvert A+S\rvert \leq K\lvert A\rvert $. Let $B,C\subseteq G$. Let $\eta =\min (1,\lvert C\rvert /\lvert B\rvert )$. There exists $T\subseteq G$ such that 

\[ \lvert T\rvert \geq K^{-4096\lceil \mathcal{L}{\eta }\rceil \epsilon ^{-2}}\lvert S\rvert  \]

 such that for any $t\in T$ we have 

\[ \|  \tau _t(\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C)-\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C\| _{\infty }\leq \epsilon . \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{Lp-orth} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\epsilon >0$ and $p \geq 2$ be an integer. Let $B \subseteq G$ be a regular Bohr set and $A\subseteq B$ with relative density $\alpha $. Let $\nu : G \to \mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ be supported on $B_\rho $, where $\rho \leq c\epsilon \alpha /\operatorname{rank}(B)$, such that $\lVert \nu \rVert _1=1$ and $\widehat{\nu }\geq 0$. If

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{th-int-gen} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\delta ,\epsilon \in (0,1)$, let $p \geq 1$ and let $k$ be a positive integer such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. There is a constant $C=C(\epsilon ,\delta ,k)>0$ such that the following holds. 

For any finite abelian group $G$ and any subset $A\subseteq G$ with $\left\lvert A\right\rvert =\alpha \left\lvert G\right\rvert $ there exists a regular Bohr set $B$ with 

\[ \operatorname{rank}(B)\leq Cp^4\log (2/\alpha )^5 \]

 and 

\[ \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-Cp^5\log (2p/\alpha )\log (2/\alpha )^6\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert  \]

 and $A' \subseteq (A-x)\cap B$ for some $x\in G$ such that 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B\right\rvert $, 

\item $\left\lvert A'\cap B'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B'\right\rvert $, where $B'=B_{\rho }$ is a regular Bohr set with $\rho \in (\tfrac {1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /dk$, and 

\item \[ \lVert (\mu _{A'}-\mu _B)\ast (\mu _{A'}- \mu _B)\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'})} \leq \epsilon \frac{\left\lvert G\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B\right\rvert }. \]

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

There is a constant C=C(ε,δ,k)>0 such that the following holds. For any finite abelian group G and any subset A⊆G with A=αG there exists a regular Bohr set B with \operatorname{rank}(B)≤Cp4(2/α)5 and B≥-Cp5(2p/α)(2/α)6G and A' ⊆(A-x)∩B for some xG such that A'≥(1-ε)αB, A'∩B'≥(1-ε)αB', where B'=Bρ is a regular Bohr set with ρ(12,1)·cδα/dk, and (μA’-μB)*(μA’- μB)p(μk·B’) ≤ε.

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} \lean{BohrSet} \leanok Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let ν: G R. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be Bohr(ν)= xG : 1-γ(x)≤ν(γ) for all γΓ. The rank of ν, denoted by rk(ν), is defined to be the size of the set of those γG such that ν(γ)<2. (Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain 0. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume ν takes only values in R≥0 - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.)

\begin{thmenv} \label{prop-it} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\epsilon >0$ and $p,k\geq 1$ be integers such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. Let $B,B',B''\subseteq G$ be regular Bohr sets of rank $d$ such that $B''\subseteq B'_{c/d}$ and $A\subseteq B$ with relative density $\alpha $. If 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{A}\circ \mu _{A}\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B'}\ast \mu _{k\cdot B''}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B''})} \geq \left(1+\epsilon \right) \mu (B)^{-1}, \]

 then there is a regular Bohr set $B'''\subseteq B''$ of rank at most 

\[ \operatorname{rank}(B''')\leq d+O_{\epsilon }(\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^4p^4) \]

 and size 

\[ \left\lvert B'''\right\rvert \geq \exp (-O_{\epsilon }(dp\mathcal{L}{\alpha /d}+\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^5p^5))\left\lvert B''\right\rvert  \]

 such that 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{B'''}*\mu _A \rVert _\infty \geq (1+c\epsilon )\mu (B)^{-1}.  \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{ap_in_ff} \lean{ap_in_ff} \leanok If $A_1,A_2,S\subseteq \mathbb {F}_q^n$ are such that $A_1$ and $A_2$ both have density at least $\alpha $ then there is a subspace $V$ of codimension 

\[ \mathrm{codim}(V)\leq 2^{27}\mathcal{L}{(}\alpha )^2\mathcal{L}{(}\epsilon \alpha )^2\epsilon ^{-2} \]

 such that 

\[ \left\lvert \langle \mu _V\ast \mu _{A_1}\ast \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle -\langle \mu _{A_1}\ast \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle \right\rvert \leq \epsilon . \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{global_dichotomy} \lean{global_dichotomy} \leanok Let $\epsilon >0$ and $\mu \equiv 1/N$. If $A,C\subseteq G$, where $C$ has density at least $\gamma $, and 

\[ \left\lvert N\langle \mu _A\ast \mu _A,\mu _C\rangle -1\right\rvert >\epsilon  \]

 then, if $f=(\mu _A-1/N)$, $\lVert f\circ f\rVert _{p(\mu )} \geq \epsilon /2N$ for $p=2\lceil \mathcal{L}{(}\gamma )\rceil $. 

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[$L_\infty $ almost periodicity] \label{linfty_ap} \lean{AlmostPeriodicity.linfty_almost_periodicity} \leanok Let $\epsilon \in (0,1]$. Let $K\geq 2$ and $A,S\subseteq G$ with $\lvert A+S\rvert \leq K\lvert A\rvert $. Let $B,C\subseteq G$. Let $\eta =\min (1,\lvert C\rvert /\lvert B\rvert )$. There exists $T\subseteq G$ such that 

\[ \lvert T\rvert \geq K^{-4096\lceil \mathcal{L}{\eta }\rceil \epsilon ^{-2}}\lvert S\rvert  \]

 such that for any $t\in T$ we have 

\[ \|  \tau _t(\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C)-\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C\| _{\infty }\leq \epsilon . \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Chang's lemma] \label{chang} \uses{large_spec} \lean{chang} \leanok Let $G$ be a finite abelian group and $f:G\to \mathbb {C}$. Let $\eta >0$ and $\alpha =N^{-1}\lVert f\rVert _1^2/\lVert f\rVert _2^2$. There exists some $\Delta \subseteq \Delta _\eta (f)$ such that

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{th-ap-int} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\epsilon >0$ and $B,B'\subseteq G$ be regular Bohr sets of rank $d$. Suppose that $A_1\subseteq B$ with density $\alpha _1$ and $A_2$ is such that there exists $x$ with $A_2\subseteq B'-x$ with density $\alpha _2$. Let $S$ be any set with $\left\lvert S\right\rvert \leq 2\left\lvert B\right\rvert $. There is a regular Bohr set $B''\subseteq B'$ of rank at most 

\[ d+O_\epsilon (\mathcal{L}{\alpha _1}^3\mathcal{L}{\alpha _2}) \]

 and size 

\[ \left\lvert B''\right\rvert \geq \exp (-O_\epsilon (d\mathcal{L}{\alpha _1\alpha _2/d}+\mathcal{L}{\alpha _1}^3\mathcal{L}{\alpha _2}\mathcal{L}{\alpha _1\alpha _2/d}))\left\lvert B'\right\rvert  \]

 such that 

\[ \left\lvert \langle \mu _{B'}\ast \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle -\langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle \right\rvert \leq \epsilon . \]

\end{thmenv}

There is a regular Bohr set B''⊆B' of rank at most d+Oε(Lα13Lα2) and size B''≥(-Oε(dLα1α2/d+Lα13Lα2Lα1α2/d))B' such that μB’*μA1○μA2,1S-μA1○μA2,1S≤ε.

\begin{thmenv} \label{flat-on-bohr} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let ${\epsilon ,\delta \in (0,1)}$ and $p,k\geq 1$ be integers such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. For any $A\subseteq G$ with density $\alpha $ there is a regular Bohr set $B$ with 

\[  d=\operatorname{rank}(B) =O_{\epsilon }\left(\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^5p^4\right) \quad \text{and}\quad \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-O_{\epsilon ,\delta }(\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^6p^5\mathcal{L}{\alpha /p})\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert   \]

 and some $A'\subseteq (A-x)\cap B$ for some $x \in G$ such that 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B\right\rvert $, 

\item $\left\lvert A'\cap B'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B'\right\rvert $, where $B'=B_{\rho }$ is a regular Bohr set with ${\rho \in (\tfrac {1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /d}$, and 

\item \[ \lVert \mu _{A'}\circ \mu _{A'}\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B''}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B''}\ast \mu _{k\cdot B'''}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B'''})} <(1+ \epsilon )\mu (B)^{-1}, \]

 for any regular Bohr sets $B'' = B'_{\rho '}$ and $B'''=B''_{\rho ''}$ satisfying ${\rho ’,\rho ”\in (\frac{1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /d}$. 

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} \lean{BohrSet} \leanok Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{drc} \lean{drc} \leanok Let $p\geq 2$ be an even integer. Let $B_1,B_2\subseteq G$ and $\mu =\mu _{B_1}\circ \mu _{B_2}$. For any finite set $A\subseteq G$ and function $f:G\to \mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ there exist $A_1\subseteq B_1$ and $A_2\subseteq B_2$ such that

\begin{thmenv} \label{Lp-orth} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\epsilon >0$ and $p \geq 2$ be an integer. Let $B \subseteq G$ be a regular Bohr set and $A\subseteq B$ with relative density $\alpha $. Let $\nu : G \to \mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ be supported on $B_\rho $, where $\rho \leq c\epsilon \alpha /\operatorname{rank}(B)$, such that $\lVert \nu \rVert _1=1$ and $\widehat{\nu }\geq 0$. If 

\[  \lVert (\mu _A-\mu _B) \circ (\mu _{A}-\mu _B)\rVert _{p(\nu )} \geq \epsilon \,  \mu (B)^{-1},  \]

 then there exists $p'\ll _\epsilon p$ such that 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{A}\circ \mu _{A}\rVert _{p'(\nu )} \geq \left(1+\tfrac {1}{4}\epsilon \right) \mu (B)^{-1}.  \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{th-int-gen} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\delta ,\epsilon \in (0,1)$, let $p \geq 1$ and let $k$ be a positive integer such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. There is a constant $C=C(\epsilon ,\delta ,k)>0$ such that the following holds. 

For any finite abelian group $G$ and any subset $A\subseteq G$ with $\left\lvert A\right\rvert =\alpha \left\lvert G\right\rvert $ there exists a regular Bohr set $B$ with 

\[ \operatorname{rank}(B)\leq Cp^4\log (2/\alpha )^5 \]

 and 

\[ \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-Cp^5\log (2p/\alpha )\log (2/\alpha )^6\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert  \]

 and $A' \subseteq (A-x)\cap B$ for some $x\in G$ such that 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B\right\rvert $, 

\item $\left\lvert A'\cap B'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B'\right\rvert $, where $B'=B_{\rho }$ is a regular Bohr set with $\rho \in (\tfrac {1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /dk$, and 

\item \[ \lVert (\mu _{A'}-\mu _B)\ast (\mu _{A'}- \mu _B)\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'})} \leq \epsilon \frac{\left\lvert G\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B\right\rvert }. \]

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{th-ap-int} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\epsilon >0$ and $B,B'\subseteq G$ be regular Bohr sets of rank $d$. \begin{thmenv} \label{th-int-gen} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\delta ,\epsilon \in (0,1)$, let $p \geq 1$ and let $k$ be a positive integer such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. There is a constant $C=C(\epsilon ,\delta ,k)>0$ such that the following holds. 

For any finite abelian group $G$ and any subset $A\subseteq G$ with $\left\lvert A\right\rvert =\alpha \left\lvert G\right\rvert $ there exists a regular Bohr set $B$ with 

\[ \operatorname{rank}(B)\leq Cp^4\log (2/\alpha )^5 \]

 and 

\[ \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-Cp^5\log (2p/\alpha )\log (2/\alpha )^6\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert  \]

 and $A' \subseteq (A-x)\cap B$ for some $x\in G$ such that 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B\right\rvert $, 

\item $\left\lvert A'\cap B'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B'\right\rvert $, where $B'=B_{\rho }$ is a regular Bohr set with $\rho \in (\tfrac {1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /dk$, and 

\item \[ \lVert (\mu _{A'}-\mu _B)\ast (\mu _{A'}- \mu _B)\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'})} \leq \epsilon \frac{\left\lvert G\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B\right\rvert }. \]

\end{enumerate}

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} \lean{BohrSet} \leanok Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let ν: G R. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be Bohr(ν)= xG : 1-γ(x)≤ν(γ) for all γΓ. The rank of ν, denoted by rk(ν), is defined to be the size of the set of those γG such that ν(γ)<2. (Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain 0. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume ν takes only values in R≥0 - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.)

\begin{thmenv} \label{th-int-gen} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\delta ,\epsilon \in (0,1)$, let $p \geq 1$ and let $k$ be a positive integer such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. There is a constant $C=C(\epsilon ,\delta ,k)>0$ such that the following holds. 

For any finite abelian group $G$ and any subset $A\subseteq G$ with $\left\lvert A\right\rvert =\alpha \left\lvert G\right\rvert $ there exists a regular Bohr set $B$ with 

\[ \operatorname{rank}(B)\leq Cp^4\log (2/\alpha )^5 \]

 and 

\[ \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-Cp^5\log (2p/\alpha )\log (2/\alpha )^6\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert  \]

 and $A' \subseteq (A-x)\cap B$ for some $x\in G$ such that 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B\right\rvert $, 

\item $\left\lvert A'\cap B'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B'\right\rvert $, where $B'=B_{\rho }$ is a regular Bohr set with $\rho \in (\tfrac {1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /dk$, and 

\item \[ \lVert (\mu _{A'}-\mu _B)\ast (\mu _{A'}- \mu _B)\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'})} \leq \epsilon \frac{\left\lvert G\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B\right\rvert }. \]

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} \lean{BohrSet} \leanok Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}

 and some $A'\subseteq (A-x)\cap B$ for some $x \in G$ such that

\begin{thmenv} \label{th-int-gen} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\delta ,\epsilon \in (0,1)$, let $p \geq 1$ and let $k$ be a positive integer such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. There is a constant $C=C(\epsilon ,\delta ,k)>0$ such that the following holds. 

For any finite abelian group $G$ and any subset $A\subseteq G$ with $\left\lvert A\right\rvert =\alpha \left\lvert G\right\rvert $ there exists a regular Bohr set $B$ with 

\[ \operatorname{rank}(B)\leq Cp^4\log (2/\alpha )^5 \]

 and 

\[ \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-Cp^5\log (2p/\alpha )\log (2/\alpha )^6\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert  \]

 and $A' \subseteq (A-x)\cap B$ for some $x\in G$ such that 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B\right\rvert $, 

\item $\left\lvert A'\cap B'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B'\right\rvert $, where $B'=B_{\rho }$ is a regular Bohr set with $\rho \in (\tfrac {1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /dk$, and 

\item \[ \lVert (\mu _{A'}-\mu _B)\ast (\mu _{A'}- \mu _B)\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'})} \leq \epsilon \frac{\left\lvert G\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B\right\rvert }. \]

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} \lean{BohrSet} \leanok Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} \lean{BohrSet} \leanok Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}
graph.node_text_content: Let ν: G R. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be Bohr(ν)= xG : 1-γ(x)≤ν(γ) for all γΓ. The rank of ν, denoted by rk(ν), is defined to be the size of the set of those γG such that ν(γ)<2. (Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain 0. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume ν takes only values in R≥0 - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.)

\begin{thmenv} \label{drc} \lean{drc} \leanok Let $p\geq 2$ be an even integer. Let $B_1,B_2\subseteq G$ and $\mu =\mu _{B_1}\circ \mu _{B_2}$. For any finite set $A\subseteq G$ and function $f:G\to \mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ there exist $A_1\subseteq B_1$ and $A_2\subseteq B_2$ such that 

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2}, f\rangle \lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^p\leq 2\langle (1_{A}\circ 1_{A})^p,f\rangle _\mu  \]

 and 

\[ \min \left( \frac{\left\lvert A_1\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_1\right\rvert },\frac{\left\lvert A_2\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B_2\right\rvert }\right)\geq \frac{1}{4}\left\lvert A\right\rvert ^{-2p}\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}^{2p}. \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{Lp-orth} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\epsilon >0$ and $p \geq 2$ be an integer. Let $B \subseteq G$ be a regular Bohr set and $A\subseteq B$ with relative density $\alpha $. Let $\nu : G \to \mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ be supported on $B_\rho $, where $\rho \leq c\epsilon \alpha /\operatorname{rank}(B)$, such that $\lVert \nu \rVert _1=1$ and $\widehat{\nu }\geq 0$. If 

\[  \lVert (\mu _A-\mu _B) \circ (\mu _{A}-\mu _B)\rVert _{p(\nu )} \geq \epsilon \,  \mu (B)^{-1},  \]

 then there exists $p'\ll _\epsilon p$ such that 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{A}\circ \mu _{A}\rVert _{p'(\nu )} \geq \left(1+\tfrac {1}{4}\epsilon \right) \mu (B)^{-1}.  \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{prop-it} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\epsilon >0$ and $p,k\geq 1$ be integers such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. Let $B,B',B''\subseteq G$ be regular Bohr sets of rank $d$ such that $B''\subseteq B'_{c/d}$ and $A\subseteq B$ with relative density $\alpha $. If 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{A}\circ \mu _{A}\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B'}\ast \mu _{k\cdot B''}\circ \mu _{k\cdot B''})} \geq \left(1+\epsilon \right) \mu (B)^{-1}, \]

 then there is a regular Bohr set $B'''\subseteq B''$ of rank at most 

\[ \operatorname{rank}(B''')\leq d+O_{\epsilon }(\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^4p^4) \]

 and size 

\[ \left\lvert B'''\right\rvert \geq \exp (-O_{\epsilon }(dp\mathcal{L}{\alpha /d}+\mathcal{L}{\alpha }^5p^5))\left\lvert B''\right\rvert  \]

 such that 

\[  \lVert  \mu _{B'''}*\mu _A \rVert _\infty \geq (1+c\epsilon )\mu (B)^{-1}.  \]

\end{thmenv}

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Rudin's exponential inequality] \label{rudin_exp} \uses{dissociated} \lean{rudin_exp_ineq} \leanok If the discrete Fourier transform of $f : G \longrightarrow \mathbb {C}$ has dissociated support, then

\begin{thmenv} \label{th-int-gen} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\delta ,\epsilon \in (0,1)$, let $p \geq 1$ and let $k$ be a positive integer such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. There is a constant $C=C(\epsilon ,\delta ,k)>0$ such that the following holds. 

For any finite abelian group $G$ and any subset $A\subseteq G$ with $\left\lvert A\right\rvert =\alpha \left\lvert G\right\rvert $ there exists a regular Bohr set $B$ with 

\[ \operatorname{rank}(B)\leq Cp^4\log (2/\alpha )^5 \]

 and 

\[ \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-Cp^5\log (2p/\alpha )\log (2/\alpha )^6\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert  \]

 and $A' \subseteq (A-x)\cap B$ for some $x\in G$ such that 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B\right\rvert $, 

\item $\left\lvert A'\cap B'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B'\right\rvert $, where $B'=B_{\rho }$ is a regular Bohr set with $\rho \in (\tfrac {1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /dk$, and 

\item \[ \lVert (\mu _{A'}-\mu _B)\ast (\mu _{A'}- \mu _B)\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'})} \leq \epsilon \frac{\left\lvert G\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B\right\rvert }. \]

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} \lean{BohrSet} \leanok Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}

Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume ν takes only values in R≥0 - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.)

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B\right\rvert $,

\begin{thmenv}[Rudin's exponential inequality] \label{rudin_exp} \uses{dissociated} \lean{rudin_exp_ineq} \leanok If the discrete Fourier transform of $f : G \longrightarrow \mathbb {C}$ has dissociated support, then

\[ S=\{  x\in G: 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}(x)>(1-\epsilon )\lVert 1_{A}\circ 1_{A}\rVert _{p(\mu )}\} , \]

 then there are $A_1\subseteq B_1$ and $A_2\subseteq B_2$ such that 

\[ \langle \mu _{A_1}\circ \mu _{A_2},1_{S}\rangle \geq 1-\delta  \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[$L_\infty $ almost periodicity] \label{linfty_ap} \lean{AlmostPeriodicity.linfty_almost_periodicity} \leanok Let $\epsilon \in (0,1]$. Let $K\geq 2$ and $A,S\subseteq G$ with $\lvert A+S\rvert \leq K\lvert A\rvert $. Let $B,C\subseteq G$. Let $\eta =\min (1,\lvert C\rvert /\lvert B\rvert )$. There exists $T\subseteq G$ such that

 such that for any $t\in T$ we have 

\[ \|  \tau _t(\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C)-\mu _A\ast 1_B\ast \mu _C\| _{\infty }\leq \epsilon . \]

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv} \label{th-int-gen} \uses{bohr-reg-def} There is a constant $c>0$ such that the following holds. Let $\delta ,\epsilon \in (0,1)$, let $p \geq 1$ and let $k$ be a positive integer such that $(k,\left\lvert G\right\rvert )=1$. There is a constant $C=C(\epsilon ,\delta ,k)>0$ such that the following holds. 

For any finite abelian group $G$ and any subset $A\subseteq G$ with $\left\lvert A\right\rvert =\alpha \left\lvert G\right\rvert $ there exists a regular Bohr set $B$ with 

\[ \operatorname{rank}(B)\leq Cp^4\log (2/\alpha )^5 \]

 and 

\[ \left\lvert B\right\rvert \geq \exp \left(-Cp^5\log (2p/\alpha )\log (2/\alpha )^6\right)\left\lvert G\right\rvert  \]

 and $A' \subseteq (A-x)\cap B$ for some $x\in G$ such that 

\begin{enumerate} \item $\left\lvert A'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B\right\rvert $, 

\item $\left\lvert A'\cap B'\right\rvert \geq (1-\epsilon )\alpha \left\lvert B'\right\rvert $, where $B'=B_{\rho }$ is a regular Bohr set with $\rho \in (\tfrac {1}{2},1)\cdot c\delta \alpha /dk$, and 

\item \[ \lVert (\mu _{A'}-\mu _B)\ast (\mu _{A'}- \mu _B)\rVert _{p(\mu _{k\cdot B'})} \leq \epsilon \frac{\left\lvert G\right\rvert }{\left\lvert B\right\rvert }. \]

\end{enumerate}

\end{thmenv}

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} \lean{BohrSet} \leanok Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}

Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume ν takes only values in R≥0 - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.)

\begin{thmenv}[Bohr sets] \label{bohr-set} \lean{BohrSet} \leanok Let $\nu : \widehat{G} \to \mathbb {R}$. The corresponding Bohr set is defined to be 

\[ \mathrm{Bohr}(\nu )=\left\{  x\in G : \left\lvert 1-\gamma (x)\right\rvert \leq \nu (\gamma )\textrm{ for all }\gamma \in \Gamma \right\} . \]

 The rank of $\nu $, denoted by $\mathrm{rk}(\nu )$, is defined to be the size of the set of those $\gamma \in \widehat{G}$ such that $\nu (\gamma )<2$. 

(Basic API facts: Bohr sets are symmetric and contain $0$. Also that, without loss of generality, we can assume $\nu $ takes only values in $\mathbb {R}_{\geq 0}$ - I think it might be easier to have the definition allow arbitrary real values, and then switch to non-negative only in proofs where convenient. Or could have the definition only allow non-negative valued functions in the first place.) 

\end{thmenv}
